hackathon-description-text: Win tickets to the May 6th event with Hillary Clinton in San Francisco! Join us at the first grassroots hackathon for Hillary 2016 and help get Hillary Clinton elected as the next President of the United States by creating innovative new tools to identify and turn out voters, help volunteers recruit more volunteers, improve organizational tools, and increase grassroots donations!

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Advisor, Investor, and Former Vice President, Intuit Labs Incubator
Serial Entrepreneur and former Vice President, Women 2.0
Northern California Organizing Director, Hillary For America

hackathon-eligibility: Engineers, technologists, designers, policy wonks, and Hillary supporters and volunteers, we’re looking for you! Attendees don't have to support Hillary as long as they are excited to make a difference, participate, and create something new!
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=901 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Judging will be based on 4 criteria weighted equally: (i) impact, (ii) creativity, (iii) simplicity, and (iv) technical achievement.

hackathon-location-address: 901 Mission St, San Francisco, CA 94103, USA
hackathon-description-header: Create new tools to help elect Hillary Clinton!
